p: Another study examined whether A. absinthium would reduce inflammation induced with carrageenan and the venom of Montivipera xanthina (Middle Eastern viper species) in rats. Half an hour before the administration of venom or carrageenan, the rodents were intraperitoneally given A. absinthium herb extract. The results indicated that administration of the plant extract at 25 and 50 mg/kg significantly inhibited venom-induced paw oedema, while doses of 12.5, 25 and 50 mg/kg were effective in carrageenan-induced inflammation [ 93].
